snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey vetoed a state budget that would have paid the pension contributions he promised in signature legislation three years ago.
abstract: Gov Chris Christie of New Jersey vetoes state budget that would have paid pension contributions he promised in signature legislation in 2011; says he will pay only $681 million toward pension obligations for state employees in given year, instead of $2.25 billion as promised; governor risks rebuke from court which said he had contractual obligation to make good on contributions.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey vetoed a state budget that would have paid the pension contributions he promised in signature legislation three years ago.
